thread.title: Twitter Implodes Over Conway’s Inaugural Outfit: ‘A Version of Cruella de Vil Who Kidnaps Freedom’
thread.title_full: Twitter Implodes Over Conway’s Inaugural Outfit: ‘A Version of Cruella de Vil Who Kidnaps Freedom’

author: Lindsey Ellefson
title: Twitter Implodes Over Conway’s Inaugural Outfit: ‘A Version of Cruella de Vil Who Kidnaps Freedom’
text:
Twitter Implodes Over Conway’s Inaugural Outfit: ‘A Version of Cruella de Vil Who Kidnaps Freedom’ by Lindsey Ellefson | 11:13 am, January 20th, 2017 
Arriving to the inaugural proceedings for Donald Trump today (her 50th birthday!), Kellyanne Conway sported this Gucci coat: Kellyanne’s outfit can be yours for just $3,600! https://t.co/4MUd33gPgC pic.twitter.com/4GbfOao2nP 
— Emily Cohn (@emily_cohn) January 20, 2017 Kellyanne Conway’s $3600 @gucci coat was designed to celebrate the city of … London. #Inauguration pic.twitter.com/OKC9Nr4Wdf 
— Kate Bennett (@KateBennett_DC) January 20, 2017 
The $3,600 piece — which she described emphatically and repeatedly as “Trump revolutionary wear!”— is beautifully made, but very ill-received outside of the runway, or, at least, on Conway. If Team Trump hates Hamilton so much then why did Kellyanne swipe this costume for the inauguration pic.twitter.com/akILl04RtA 
— Alex Gold (@Alex_Gold) January 20, 2017 Interesting choice of outfits for @KellyannePolls . I’m thinking her fashion consultant was sick… pic.twitter.com/L6A1mrlSY3 
— Rachel Stockman (@RStockmanLAW) January 20, 2017 Kellyanne Conway is dressed exactly how Captain America’s girlfriend would have been in 1945. pic.twitter.com/4Le3mw3FVN 
— James Skylar Gerrond (@JimmySky) January 20, 2017 @Alex_Gold Hey! She did a GREAT job of matching those colors up with… pic.twitter.com/RgkUcRtJ9Y 
— The Amazing Ron R. (@RAR18639) January 20, 2017 “DA’HELL YOU MEAN THEY CLOSED FAO SCHWARTZ DOWN? IM SCHEDULED FROM 3-9 TODAY.” #TrumpInauguration pic.twitter.com/GLVW3pi2Z9 
— The Levine Machine (@Eitanthegoalie) January 20, 2017 Can’t believe Steve Bannon didn’t wear a matching outfit with Kellyanne Conway. pic.twitter.com/6Vg530gUaF 
— Matt Fuller (@MEPFuller) January 20, 2017 Why does Kellyanne Conway look like the old New England Patriots logo? pic.twitter.com/swgdHH53v6 
— Tyler Brooke (@TylerDBrooke) January 20, 2017 Which Nutcracker statue did Kellyanne Conway rob to get this look? https://t.co/1N9an879Er 
— Gabriella Paiella (@GMPaiella) January 20, 2017 It’s authoritarian chic? pic.twitter.com/EPfHd4sdkU 
— Ana Marie Cox (@anamariecox) January 20, 2017 Kellyanne Conway’s 18th century cosplay is in honor of the incoming government’s approach to science and women’s health pic.twitter.com/mKFnGYYf8e 
— Patrick Monahan (@pattymo) January 20, 2017 Kellyanne Conway dressed as the era Trump wants to take America back to. #InaugurationDay pic.twitter.com/Vrmc1Bq3Nz 
— The Daily Show (@TheDailyShow) January 20, 2017 Who wore it better: Kellyanne Conway or Paddington Bear? pic.twitter.com/CP2M6fzLyD 
— Michael Hopper (@mhopp7) January 20, 2017 at least did made me laugh? what is this ghastly ghoul wearing now pic.twitter.com/QkBRkuYlwT 
— Aminatou Sow (@aminatou) January 20, 2017 Kellyanne Conway’s inauguration outfit has made my eyes roll back so hard I am now in the past pic.twitter.com/4TZTJBN0mh 
— Stephen Leng (@steveleng) January 20, 2017 @wholeassgoat racist american girl doll 
— Aminatou Sow (@aminatou) January 20, 2017 “Is this the Nutcracker LARPing meet up?”– Kellyanne Conway pic.twitter.com/Ru93aC7kgj 
— Stephen Arkilanian (@FnordEscape) January 20, 2017 Girl.. absolutely fucking bye pic.twitter.com/D4h0fha8qA
